Dreadplague was pushed hard to the ground and she fell crashing down
in it. Tyrael landed some meters away and looked around. It seemed as
they had won the day!

Tyrael: All right, Tripredacus, regroup. Kaiser, please go talk with
our two new soldiers. Dreadplague, I'll want to talk to you, but
first... (he turned to Destructor and smiled) Destructor... It is good
to see you again!

But Dreadplague did not rise. In fact, she still had Riekan's harpoon
solidly lodged inside of her and she was barely able to move it.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...>"
<cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> Without warning, Devilcat breaks away from Kaiser.  "Rogues, to me!" 
> he calls.
> 
> Reikan disentangles himself from Dreadplague, and he, Fury, Noir, and 
> Jayde join their commander in what would seem to be a full, if 
> abrupt, retreat.
> 
> "What's going on, Devilcat?" Noir asks, speaking quietly so the enemy 
> won't hear.  "Why are we abandoning the battle?"
> 
> "We were getting nowhere," Devilcat explains.  "There's no use in 
> prolonging things.  There will be another time.  Trust me."
